intro: Oxytropis vassilczenkoi subsp. vassilczenkoi, commonly known as the Vassilczenkoi locoweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
